alert.note: Alert for Beltrami; Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 12 at 3:57PM CDT until June 12 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MARSHALL AND WESTERN BELTRAMI COUNTIES... At 357 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Grygla, or 27 miles northeast of Thief River Falls, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Grygla around 400 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
